document.docTitle: Leptus sidorchukae Costa & Klompen & Bernardi & Gonçalves & Ribeiro & Pepato 2019, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Multi-instar descriptions of cave dwelling Erythraeidae (Trombidiformes: Parasitengona) employing an integrative approach

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Multi-instar descriptions of cave dwelling Erythraeidae (Trombidiformes: Parasitengona) employing an integrative approach

mods:name.mods:namePart: Bernardi, Leopoldo Ferreira De Olivei- Ra

taxonomicName.authorityName: Costa & Klompen & Bernardi & Gonçalves & Ribeiro & Pepato

subSubSection.paragraph: Larva : Idiosoma bearing 114–118 (N= 5) dorsal setae, ventral surface with a shorter pair of barbed setae between coxae I, four setae between coxae II and nine setae between coxae II and III. Palp setal formula: 0-2B-2B-3B- 4B1N1ζ1ω. Gnathosoma conical, as barbed, long (40–46) and placed laterally; bs shorter (32–37) than as, thin and barbed; tibia and genu I each bearing one piriform microseta (κ1 and κ2). Deutonymph : center eyes 234–296 (N= 5) apart (O —O), dorsal setae 36–66 long, barbed and evenly distributed. Eyes cornea diameter (O) 17–23 (N= 7), eyes relatively small ( Fig. 10A and B ) when compared with the correlated intersensillar distance ISD/O=10.61–12.76 (N= 7). Crista metopica 293–335 (N= 5) restricted to the anterior half of the idiosoma. Sensillar area with 3–4 short (30–46, N= 5) barbed setae, anterior to sensilla. Tibia and genu I each with one microseta (κ) placed at their distal end, shape similar to that in larva ( Fig. 10C and G ). Female : O=24–28; O—O= 369–535 (N= 5). Eyes relatively small ( Fig. 11A and B ) when compared with the intersensillar distance ISD/O= 14.39–15.2, N= 3. Crista metopica 417–490 (N= 5) restricted to the anterior half of idiosoma. Anterior sensillar area with 7–8 short (40–70, N= 5) barbed setae anterior to sensilla. Genital pore 270–302 (N= 5) with two pairs of oval, small, and overlapping genital acetabula, placed at the posterior half of the genital pore. Tibia and genu I each with one microseta (κ) placed at their distal end, shape similar to that in larva. Male : O—O=370–414 (N= 2), O=26–29 (N= 2); Eyes relatively small ( Fig. 13A, B and 22A ) when compared with the intersensillar distance ISD/O=14.17–14.23 (N= 2). Similar to females in most respects. Genital pore 198, with 25 setae on each genital epivalve (N= 1). Internally, operculum composed of two anteriorly articulated longitudinal sclerites of the ejaculatory complex with 11 eugenital setae on each side over protuberances (N= 1).

Type Material .
Holotype : Larva UFMG
AC 151093
collected at 19°34’36.0”S , 44°01’13.0”W , in an unnamed limestone cave, Pedro Leopoldo municipality, Minas Gerais State , Brazil , between
July 22
th and
August 18 th
of 2015. Larval paratypes : UFMG
AC 150875
,
151098 , 151100
and 151510. Deutonymphal paratypes : UFMG
AC 150321
,
150323 , 150326 , 151101 , 151206 , 150710 , 150711 , 150717 , 150729 , 151208 and 150730
. Female paratypes : UFMG
AC 150693
,
151245 , 151107 and 151108
. Male paratypes : UFMG
AC 150853
,
150725 and 150932
. The specimens were collected in the entrance, penumbra and aphotic zone from
Gruta do Salitre
and other unnamed caves (
See Table I
for detailed collecting data).

Gnathosoma conical, as barbed, long (40–46; N= 5) and placed laterally; bs shorter (32–37) than as , thin and barbed. Short (16) and smooth galeala ( cs ) visible in only a few specimens. Palpal setal formula: 0-2B-2B-3B- 4B1N1ζ1ω. Palp tibial claw entire ( Fig. 8A, B ).
Leg I: Ta—23B,1Cp, 2 ζ, 1 ω; Ti—15B, 1κ, 2 φ; Ge—8B, 1κ, 1σ; TFe—5B; BFe—3B; Tr—1B; Cx—1B.
Leg II: Ta—22B, 1 ω, 2 ζ; Ti—15B, 2 φ; Ge—8B, 1κ, 1σ; TFe—5B; BFe—3B; Tr—1B; Cx—1B.
Leg III: Ta—22B, 1 ζ; Ti—15B,1 φ; Ge—8B; TFe—5B; BFe—2B; Tr—1B; Cx—1B.

Female: Measurements summarized in Table IV. Color in life unknown. Idiosoma oval ( Fig. 11A ). Dorsal setae similar to deutonymph ( Fig. 10B , 11 A–B). Short crista metopica (417–490 N= 5) restricted to anterior half of idiosoma; positioned between a pair of small eyes, which are 369–535 (N= 5) apart. Crista carries two pairs of filiform sensillary setae with faint setules and 7–8 short (40–70, N= 5) barbed setae in anterior sensillar area, inserted anterior to sensilla ( Fig. 11B ). Genital pore elongated, bearing two pairs of small genital acetabula (G. ac.), both with the same oval shape and inserted in posterior half of genital pore ( Fig. 12B ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 8.
Leptus sidorchukae
sp. nov. larva. A: Gnathosoma ventral view; B: Palp-tarsus; C: Dorsal scutum; D: Idiosoma dorsal view; E: Idiosoma ventral view. Scale: A= 100 µm, B= 20 µm, C= 50 µm; D and E= 200 µm.

FIGURE 9.
Leptus sidorchukae
sp. nov. larva. A: Leg I; B: Leg II; C: Leg III; D: Distal portion of tarsus I; E: Distal portion of tarsus II; F: Distal portion of tarsus III. Scale: A, B, C= 100 µm; D, E and F= 20 µm.

FIGURE 10.
Leptus sidorchukae
sp. nov. deutonymph. A: General view; B: Crista metoptica, eyes and dorsal setae (detail); C: Leg I, tibia and tarsus, relative position of micro setae κ1 and κ2 indicated; D: Palp dorsal view; E: Palp ventral view; F: Palptarsus; G: Piriform microseta κ1; H=Anal pore. Scale: A= 400 µm, B and C= 200 µm; D and E= 100 µm; F, G and H= 50 µm.

FIGURE 11.
Leptus sidorchukae
sp. nov. female. A: General view; B: Crista metopica, eyes and dorsal setae; C: Palp dorsal view; D: Palp ventral view. Scale: A= 1000 µm, B= 200 µm, C and D= 100 µm.

FIGURE 12.
Leptus sidorchukae
sp. nov. female. A: Tarsus and tibia I; B: Ventral view showing the anal and genital pore; C: Palp tarsus dorsal view; D: Palp ventral view. Scale: A and B= 200 µm, C= 50 µm and D= 20 µm.

FIGURE 13.
Leptus sidorchukae
sp. nov. male. A: General view; B: Crista metopica, eyes and dorsal setae; C: Genital and anal pore, black arrow pointing internal setae of the ejaculatory complex; D: Leg I, tibia and tarsus, relative position of microsetae κ1 and κ2 indicated; E: Gnathosoma ventral view; F: Gnathosoma dorsal view; G: Piriform microseta κ2; H=Palp tarsus. Scale: A= 400 µm, B and C= 200 µm; D and E= 100 µm; F, G and H= 50 µm.

TABLE V. Metric data for the males of
Leptus sidorchukae
sp. nov. and
Charletonia rocciai Treat & Flechtmann, 1979
. Some of the metric characters are not applicable for all species and are marked by (NA).

subSubSection.paragraph: Genital pore elongated, bearing 25 setae on each side of the external border. Internally, the operculum is composed of two, anteriorly articulated, longitudinal sclerites of the ejaculatory complex each of which has 11 eugenital setae over protuberances on each side (black arrow on Fig. 13C ). Tips of proximal arms of ejaculatory complex distinguishable and indicated on Fig. 13C .
